intro: Scapisenecio, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plants typically have linear or strap-shaped leaves and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Scapisenecio species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions. They are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
